alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 4:52PM MST until February 22 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado... Kit Carson County in east central Colorado... Wallace County in west central Kansas... Sherman County in northwestern Kansas... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 452 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 11 miles north of Vona to 14 miles north of Chivington, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Locations impacted include... Goodland, Burlington, Cheyenne Wells, Sharon Springs, Stratton, Kanorado and Ruleton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 35. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 407 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 206, and near mile marker 211. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
